chargeHist.descr: Theft of Mail (less than 10 pieces of mail)

result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Attorney Cassie Miller has been appointed to represent the defendant.
Hearing on February 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.

02:54 PM Defendant Chad L Conrath in court, in custody, with attorney Luis Daniel Gutierrez.   Christian Farina appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

The court calls the matter for Status of Counsel.
Attorney Gutierrez states that the Defendant is still eligible, however does not have a report yet on who will be appointed or how many contacts where made.
The court notes that it can not make findings for good cause to toll the time limits, since there is no report filed by the SPD. 
The Court rescinds the its prior findings.
The Court will at this time find good cause to toll the time limits for prelim hearing.
The Court will adjourn the prelim hearing set tomorrow at this time.   The Court orders the State to call off their witnesses.
The Court orders the SPD to file a report on how many attorney they contacted prior to the next hearing.  Hearing scheduled for February 1, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on January 26, 2022 at 08:15 am.
Status conference on January 25, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
